Interface ec.e.openers.Recipe 
All Packages  Class Hierarchy  This Package  Previous  Next  Index

Interface ec.e.openers.Recipe

public interface Recipe
extends Object
The interface to allow code outside this module to extend and alter how various classes are inspected/encoded/decoded.

NO_ARGS
An array of no Objects.

bodyArgs(Object)
Given an object of the type() this recipe encodes, return an array of objects that can be encoded according to the body part of the recipe's openerID().
commentary()
cook(Object, Object[])
Given an object, 'halfBaked', returned by this recipe's halfBakedInstance method, and an array of objects that corresponds to the body part of the recipe's openerID, complete the initialization of the object using this body data.
halfBakedInstance(Object[])
Given an array of objects that corresponds to the preface part of the recipe's openerID, make and return a new object partially initialized (halfBaked) using this preface data.
halfBakedInstanceOf(Class, Object[])
Like 'halfBakedInstance', but will return an instance of 'sub', where type() is assignable from 'sub'.
openerID()
The openerID under which this Recipe will be registered.
prefaceArgs(Object)
Given an object of the type() this recipe encodes, return an array of objects that can be encoded according to the preface part of the recipe's openerID().
type()
What is the actual type of objects that this recipe will encode, or that will be returned by this recipe on decode? On encode, the recipe is typically looked up by this type.

NO_ARGS 
  public final static Object NO_ARGS[]
An array of no Objects. This is returned by implementations of prefaceArgs() or bodyArgs() when there aren't any. Zero-length arrays are the only kind that are immutable, and hence the only kind that may be statically shared.

type 
  public abstract Class type()
What is the actual type of objects that this recipe will encode, or that will be returned by this recipe on decode? On encode, the recipe is typically looked up by this type.
openerID 
  public abstract String openerID()
The openerID under which this Recipe will be registered. The openerID is used by the corresponding Chef to encode itself, and is how the recipe is looked up on decode.
See Also:
openerID
commentary 
  public abstract Object commentary()
Returns:
nullOk, suspect;
See Also:
commentary
prefaceArgs 
  public abstract Object[] prefaceArgs(Object obj)
Given an object of the type() this recipe encodes, return an array of objects that can be encoded according to the preface part of the recipe's openerID().
Parameters:
obj - nullOk, suspect;
bodyArgs 
  public abstract Object[] bodyArgs(Object obj)
Given an object of the type() this recipe encodes, return an array of objects that can be encoded according to the body part of the recipe's openerID().
Parameters:
obj - nullOk, suspect;
halfBakedInstance 
  public abstract Object halfBakedInstance(Object prefaceArgs[])
Given an array of objects that corresponds to the preface part of the recipe's openerID, make and return a new object partially initialized (halfBaked) using this preface data.
Returns:
nullOk, suspect;
halfBakedInstanceOf 
  public abstract Object halfBakedInstanceOf(Class sub,
                                             Object prefaceArgs[])
Like 'halfBakedInstance', but will return an instance of 'sub', where type() is assignable from 'sub'. This lets a Recipe for a class Foo be used to initialize the Foo part of a class Bar where Bar is a subclass of Foo. Foo's Recipe should therefore ignore prefaceArgs beyond those it expects. These might be used by our caller to initialize the Bar part.
Returns:
nullOk, suspect;
cook 
  public abstract void cook(Object halfBaked,
                            Object bodyArgs[])
Given an object, 'halfBaked', returned by this recipe's halfBakedInstance method, and an array of objects that corresponds to the body part of the recipe's openerID, complete the initialization of the object using this body data. This Recipe should ignore bodyArgs beyond what it expects. This might be used by our caller when the actual object is a subclass of what this Recipe expects.
Parameters:
halfBaked - nullOk, suspect;
